ProfessionalSummary:
A creative and accomplished graphic designer with demonstrated experience in layout, typography, print and web
design, web banners, and instructional design. Established capabilities in E-learning, social media graphics,
packaging, video, and project management. Utilizes strong technical skills to develop compelling, user-friendly
designs and customer-facing materials for print, digital, and web audiences and platforms. A dynamic and versatile
top-performer who is adept at driving projects from concept to delivery.

EducationDetails.Text: LATIN UNIVERSITY OF AMERICA, Michoacán, Mexico, B.A., Graphic Communication Design, ((year))

ExperienceSummary.Description: ~~~~~~   is experienced in the management of:  Marketing (Channel Management).    ~~~~~~   has 19 years of work experience, with 3 years of management experience, including a mid-level position.
ExperienceSummary.ManagementStory:
Starting on 1/1/2011, the candidate held the following mid-level management position for 3 years:
	Title: Director of Design for CATHOLIC DIOCESE OF DALLAS
ExperienceSummary.AttentionNeeded: ATTENTION: The candidate appears to have been in management in a past role (Director of Design for CATHOLIC DIOCESE OF DALLAS), but was not in management in the most recent role as Designer and Developer I for RENT-A-CENTER HEADQUARTERS.

Positions.Description:
Designed and developed programs necessary to facilitate blended learning approach focused on skill development and performance optimization, including E-Learning guides, infographics, and training videos.

Reviewed existing learning programs on continuous basis to ensure relevancy, accuracy of content, and appropriateness of delivery methods under management's guidance edited, updated, and redesigned content to ensure all such programs

remained in alignment with business, human resources, and training objectives and expectations.
Developed, designed, and assisted in implementation of new learning programs to achieve blended learning approach for all
assigned training programs.

Leveraged and used Adobe Captivate, After Effects, and Camtasia software for projects.
Captured and edited video for integration into E-learning courses.

Created monthly product catalogs, POP signage, and promotional, customer-facing marketing materials.
Conducted art and photo search, selection, and preparation of materials for print, web, and social media (graphics, banners,

GIFs). Created and updated web materials for social media and company website.

Assisted in managing product promotions.
Partnered with video production team to direct commercials, and ensured mobile compatibility.

Produced marketing collateral guidelines used by teams in local retail installment stores ("Get It Now" in Wisconsin and

"Home Choice" in Minnesota) to ensure merchandising practices met corporate standards.

Developed branding materials (including logo, business cards, and promotional merchandise) for launch of company's
rebranded franchising program, with collateral in use at 70 locations nationwide.

Played instrumental role in proposing and gaining leadership buy-in on initiative to move production of point-of-purchase
materials in house, projected to deliver up to $5,000 in savings monthly.

Recognized elementary phrasing in Spanish-language promotional materials developed by outside team and provided
accurate translation, ensuring high-quality deliverables.

Ensured brand-specific images remained readily available and maintained database of all projects, contributors, and timelines to keep projects on schedule.

Produced E-learning guides, workbooks, training materials, and graphic content, including front covers and illustrations.
Created layout for company's new hire training program, used by 3,000 stores nationwide and recognized as top New Hire

Training Program in 2015 by Training Magazine.
Designed, localized, and partnered with international operations team to launch new hire training program for 350 stores across
Mexico.

Originated corporate Christmas card delivered to estimated 15,000 customers across U.S., Mexico, and Puerto Rico.
Delivered high-quality work, resulting in increasingly strategic and high-value projects.

Designed layout for monthly, Spanish-language Revista Católica magazine distributed to 2,400 readers monthly and biweekly
publication of The Texas Catholic Newspaper. Produced front covers and illustrations for all sections, as well as

advertisements, brochures, and promotional print materials.
•	Reduced costs on printing magazine, T-shirts, and banners by using franchise printer versus local printer to save $5,000.

Designed and edited text translation of Guía de Compras 2010, Consumer Reports' first Spanish-language edition.

Developed and edited Rio Grande River newspaper prototype.

Created artwork, layout, and headline design and edited photos for The Dallas Morning News.

Designed 300 flyers for Texas Can Academies Summer Camps.

Produced layout and headline designs for Spanish-language, twice-weekly sister publication
of The Dallas Morning News. Edited photos. Created front covers, locator maps, and illustrations for special sections and projects, as well as for advertising and promotional print materials. Awarded honorable mention by Associated Press for Feature Page Design by Individual in 2009.

Designed and edited newspaper layout and headlines.
Edited photos. Coordinated and sent final proofs for printing.

Achievements: Created layout for company's new hire training program, used by 3,000 stores nationwide and recognized as top New Hire
Earned Gold Award for Outstanding Food Section (2010), National Association of Hispanic Publications
advertising and promotional print materials. Awarded honorable mention by Associated Press for Feature Page Design by Individual in 2009
QualificationsSummary:
COMPUTER SKILLS

Adobe InDesign, Illustrator, Photoshop, After Effects, Captivate, Bridge, Camtasia, Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, CCI's Layout Champ

Findings.Message: You should not use the PDF format for your resume. Due to inherent limitations with text extraction from PDFs, you are less likely to get a job when using a PDF resume.
Each section type should only appear once in a resume.
Every position in a resume should have a job title.
Every position in a resume should have an employer name.

The following section was identified as a skills section type: 'COMPUTER SKILLS'. Skills should not be in a separate section, but instead, each skill should be included in the descriptions of work history or education. THIS IS INCREDIBLY IMPORTANT FOR AI MATCHING ALGORITHMS

SUMMARY

A creative and accomplished graphic designer with demonstrated experience in layout, typography, print and web
design, web banners, and instructional design. Established capabilities in E-learning, social media graphics,
packaging, video, and project management. Utilizes strong technical skills to develop compelling, user-friendly
designs and customer-facing materials for print, digital, and web audiences and platforms. A dynamic and versatile
top-performer who is adept at driving projects from concept to delivery.
